  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
This could be a landmark day for
  immigration in the United
    States. Key senators from both parties
  agreed with the White House on an immigration overhaul that claims to fortify
  the U.S. border and
  quickly give legal status to the millions of illegal immigrants who already
  live in the United States.
  President Bush called the proposal “orderly and fair.” Sharyl
  Attkisson will explain the plan and Sandra Hughes will look at the potential
  political and economic ramifications.
 
In Iraq,
  the massive search continues for the missing U.S. soldiers from the 10th
  Mountain Division. More than 4,000 troops were on the hunt this week, and our
  Mark Strassmann will have a firsthand report from the area that’s being
  searched.
 
And to cap off our series “Gotta Have It: The
  Hard Sell to Kids,” Nancy Cordes will report that Generation Next is
  earning a new moniker: Generation Plastic. The average college student
  graduates with more than $3,000 in credit card debt, and now marketers are
  trying to hook kids as young as 3-years-old on spending money they
  don’t have.
 
We’ll wrap up tonight’s broadcast by
  giving you a peak inside the handwritten diaries Ronald Reagan kept during
  his eight years in the White House. What was his revelation after being shot?
  What ailment did he warn you can catch from your kids? Join us for the
  answers tonight.
 
Thanks!
 




Katie Couric
